page.title: 05PARK HOUSE FARM LAYER MARNEY
page.content: Mr and Mrs J Strathern are arable farmers. They own three hundred acres of wheat, barley, oilseed rape and potatoes. In 1951 Mr R Strathern owned the farm and in the early seventies his son took over. They have thirty beef cattle and seven hundred turkeys for Christmas. The farmhouse was built in 1952. The six grain silos hold one hundred tons of wheat or barley. They own a combine a digger, four tractors and they do contract mole draining with caterpiller tractors. They have one full time worker. The major changes they have seen are in the different kinds of machinery - fewer men are needed to do the work. He gets up about six and has his breakfast at nine. Mr Strathern always wanted to farm because he likes watching things grow.
